description: A long, thin musical instrument played by blowing across a hole.
A small stringed instrument held under the chin and played with a bow.
A percussion instrument with a hollow body covered with a membrane.
A large keyboard instrument with black and white keys that make sound when hit.
A stringed instrument with a long neck and a body with a flat front.
A brass instrument with a flared bell and three buttons for changing pitch.
A brass instrument with a curved body and keys, played with a reed mouthpiece.
A woodwind instrument with a straight body and a single-reed mouthpiece.
A large stringed instrument that rests on the floor and is played with a bow.
A brass instrument with a slide used to change the pitch.
A large triangular stringed instrument with strings perpendicular to the soundboard.
A box-shaped instrument with a bellows and keys or buttons, played by pressing the keys and squeezing the bellows.
A wind instrument with a bag and pipes, played by blowing air into the bag.
A slender woodwind instrument with a double-reed mouthpiece.
A large woodwind instrument with a double reed and a distinctive curved bell.
A percussion instrument with wooden bars struck with mallets to produce sound.
An electronic instrument that generates sound with oscillators and is played with a keyboard.
An electronic musical instrument controlled without physical contact by the performer.
A small, lute-like stringed instrument with a rounded body and a neck with frets.
A stringed instrument with a drum-like body and a long neck, played with fingers or a pick.
A small four-stringed guitar of Hawaiian origin.
A pair of small drums attached to each other and played with the hands.
A tall, narrow drum from Cuba, played with the hands.
Large copper pots with drumheads that are tuned to specific pitches.
A musical instrument with wooden bars of different lengths, played by striking with mallets.
